title: Columbia Administrators Fire Off Hostile and Dismissive Text Messages , Vomit Emojis During Alumni Reunion Panel on Jewish Life
message:
Photos of text messages sent during panel captured by attendee provide a glimpse into administration's attitude toward the plight of Jewish students on campusOn Friday, May 31, alumni descended on Columbia University's Manhattan campus to celebrate their class reunions.
In addition to eating and drinking, the festivities included several panel discussions featuring professors and administrators.
The administrators expressed skepticism that Jewish students had experienced targeting or discrimination.
The messages are not time-stamped, so it is not always clear to what comments from the panel the participants are referring.
Among the comments Chang-Kim offered to Kromm and Patashnick: "This panel is really making the administration look like jokers."

title: NY Dem challenging Bowman shares dozens of donors with Republican who sought Santo seat
message:
What does a Long Island Republican who ran to replace George Santos have in common with a Westchester Democrat in a solidly blue congressional district?
The district Latimer is running in is heavily Democratic and will almost certainly be decided by the June 25 primary.
The Latimer campaign declined to comment on the record, though a spokesperson noted he endorsed Suozzi in the Long Island race.
The median household income is much higher in the Long Island district that Pilip sought to represent.
Meanwhile, the district Latimer is vying to represent has a reliably blue electoral track record.

title: Holocaust survivor :  You have to be hopeful
message:
As a young woman growing up in Holland, she survived the Holocaust and went up against the Nazis in the 1940s during World War II.
The luncheon was held at the Best Western Plus Coeur d'Alene Inn on what would have been the 95th birthday of Anne Frank.
Anne Frank died at the age of 15.
Noble and Zellman, members of Temple Beth Shalom, are the founders of the annual remembrance of the Holocaust at Temple Beth Shalom.
She described Anne Frank as happy and smart.
